body: Is it possible to simulate hybrid ventalition(natural ventalition and air-conditioned) with honeybee? For example, if the outside temperature is between 19-23 °C then use natural ventalition, otherweise use air-conditioning if set point of room temperature hit the set point for cooling and heating? It is like the chapter about hzbrid ventalition in the paper [http://docs.lib.purdue.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1034&con...](http://docs.lib.purdue.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1034&context=ihpbc&sei-redir=1&referer=http%3A%2F%2Fcn.bing.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Denergyplus%2Bhybrid%2Bventilation%26FORM%3DAWRE#search=%22energyplus%20hybrid%20ventilation%22)
topic: how to simulate hybrid ventilation with honeybee?

replies.body:
Yi,

You can absolutely do this with Honeybee.  See this discussion for more information on how to set it up and for recommendations on thermostat temperature set points:

[http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/how-is-natu...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/how-is-natural-ventilation-determined-based-on-min-and-max-values)

-Chris
thanks for the guide to link. I asked a further question there, if it is possible to use setback for heating and cooling in hybrid ventilation, do you have any idea?
